name: Cave LLC
description: Cave's powerful APIs provide analytics over very large sets of time series data. Cave makes it easy to collect billions of events, with innate features to combine any time series into new time series. One of the enabling features of Cave is the ability to do alerting with a very high signal to noise ratio to monitor any business application of web application.

role.description: The role that a user has in an organization or team

values.name: admin
values.description: The administrator of the organization/team. Can do all operations.

values.name: member
values.description: A member of the organization/team. Can do most operations.

values.name: viewer
values.description: A read-only user of the organization/team. Can only view data.

values.name: team
values.description: A user associated indirectly to an organization, through at least one team.

values.name: count
values.description: The number of events in the metric data set.

values.name: min
values.description: The smallest value in the metric data set.

values.name: max
values.description: The largest value in the metric data set.

values.name: mean
values.description: The average of the values in the metric data set.

values.name: mode
values.description: The most frequent value in the metric data set.

values.name: median
values.description: The middle value in the metric data set.

values.name: sum
values.description: The sum of all values in the metric data set.

values.name: stddev
values.description: The standard deviation of all values in the metric data set.

values.name: p99
values.description: The 99th percentile value in the metric data set.

values.name: p999
values.description: The 99.9th percentile value in the metric data set.

values.name: p95
values.description: The 95th percentile value in the metric data set.

values.name: p90
values.description: The 90th percentile value in the metric data set.

issue.description: An issue affecting CAVE right now, or recently closed

fields.name: description
fields.description: The description of the issue

fields.name: since
fields.description: The time this issue has begun

fields.name: until
fields.description: The time this issue has been resolved

status.description: The list of current and recent issues affecting CAVE

fields.name: current
fields.description: Ongoing issues affecting CAVE

fields.name: recent
fields.description: Recent issues that affected CAVE

user.description: A user is a real-world person who is using the CAVE service. The user signs up for CAVE, and then interacts with the service through the APIs. Every call to the API needs to use a token that is obtained after a successful login.

fields.name: first_name
fields.description: First name of this user

fields.name: last_name
fields.description: Last name of this user

fields.name: email
fields.description: Email of this user

user_organization.description: An organization associated with a user.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of organization

fields.name: role
fields.description: The role this user has in this organization.

user_team.description: A team associated with a user.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of team

fields.name: role
fields.description: The role this user has in this team.

fields.name: token
fields.description: Authorization token for this user

fields.name: expires
fields.description: Date/time when this token expires and user must login again

member.description: An organization or team user, with the role

fields.name: user
fields.description: User data

fields.name: role
fields.description: The role of the user in the organization or team.

organization.description: An organization is a real-world customer of the CAVE service. Each organization is identified by a name, which must be unique. Each organization can have one or more teams associated with it, allowing for data to be segregated. Security is managed with organization tokens. A token is created automatically for every new organization.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of this organization. Must be unique in the CAVE service. Must be URL friendly.

fields.name: email
fields.description: The email associated with this organization.

fields.name: notification_url
fields.description: The URL where CAVE should post notifications for this organization.

fields.name: tokens
fields.description: The tokens associated with this organization. Use one of these to authenticate requests that require an organization owner. There must be at least one token for an organization. A default token is created automatically for newly created organizations, and it's not possible to delete the last organization token.

team.description: Each team has its own data. A team can push data into CAVE by using an active token. A team can have one or more tokens associated with it, allowing for tokens to be rotated, for security purposes. A team is solely responsible for administration of its tokens. A team token is created automatically for every new team.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of this team. Must be unique for the organization.

fields.name: tokens
fields.description: The tokens associated with this team. Use one of these to authenticate requests that require a team owner. There must be at least one token for a team. A default token is created automatically for newly created teams, and it's not possible to delete the last team token.

token.description: A token is a security string, used to authenticate requests. Some requests can only be executed by the organization owner, and these must be authenticated with an organization token. Other requests can only be executed by a team owner, and these can be authenticated with either a team token, or an organization token.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for a token. This is only useful for the delete operation.

fields.name: description
fields.description: A description for the token. Useful to describe what a token is for.

fields.name: value
fields.description: The actual token string that must be used to authenticate requests. Pass this as a Bearer token in the Authorization field of the HTTP request. See http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6750 for details.

fields.name: created
fields.description: The date on which the token was created. This is a read-only field.

metric.description: This entity encapsulates metric data that can be stored in CAVE.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the metric. This should describe what the metric is for, as well as the unit of measurement.

fields.name: tags
fields.description: The metric tags, which are key-value pairs of strings. These describe and categorise the metric and where/how it was collected.

fields.name: timestamp
fields.description: The timestamp of this data point, as a number of seconds since the Epoch.

fields.name: value
fields.description: The value of this data point. There is no unit of measurement, but this should be implied from the metric name.

metric_data.description: This entity encapsulates a data point for a metric.

fields.name: time
fields.description: The timestamp of this data point, as a number of seconds since the Epoch.

fields.name: value
fields.description: The value of this data point. There is no unit of measurement, but this should be implied from the metric name.

metric_data_bulk.description: This entity encapsulates data for a metric.

fields.name: metrics
fields.description: A sequence of data points.

metric_info.description: This entity encapsulates information about a metric.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the metric.

fields.name: tags
fields.description: The tags of the metric.

alert.description: This entity describes a configured alert, what to check and how often.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The alert identifier.

fields.name: description
fields.description: A description for this alert. Should be descriptive about the metric(s) and threshold(s) involved

fields.name: enabled
fields.description: A state for this alert. If not enabled, the alert is not checked.

fields.name: period
fields.description: How often the condition should be checked. Must contain a number followed by 'm', 'h', or 'd'.

fields.name: condition
fields.description: The alarm condition to check. See documentation for accepted formats.

fields.name: handbook_url
fields.description: The URL of the alert handbook.

fields.name: routing
fields.description: Information for routing the alert to the appropriate notification service.

fields.name: related_metrics
fields.description: Metrics related to this alert.

alert_metric.description: Information about a metric related to an alert.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the metric.

fields.name: tags
fields.description: The metric tags.

fields.name: aggregator
fields.description: The aggregation done on the metric. Only applies to aggregator metrics.

fields.name: period_seconds
fields.description: The period in seconds for the aggregation. Only applies to aggregator metrics.

operations.description: Evaluate data for organization metrics.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: Name of organization for which metric data is evaluated.

parameters.name: condition
parameters.description: The condition to be evaluated. Same format as an alert condition.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: The start of the time interval for which data is evaluated.

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: The end of the time interval for which data is evaluated. Optional, defaults to current date/time.

parameters.name: interval
parameters.description: The interval, as number of minutes, at which data is evaluated. Optional, defaults to 1 minute.

operations.description: Evaluate data for team metrics.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: Name of organization for which metric data is evaluated.

parameters.name: team
parameters.description: Name of team for which metric data is evaluated.

parameters.name: condition
parameters.description: The condition to be evaluated. Same format as an alert condition.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: The start of the time interval for which data is evaluated.

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: The end of the time interval for which data is evaluated. Optional, defaults to current date/time.

parameters.name: interval
parameters.description: The interval, as number of minutes, at which data is evaluated. Optional, defaults to 1 minute.

operations.description: Retrieve data for an organization metric.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: Name of organization for which metric data is retrieved.

parameters.name: metric
parameters.description: The name of the metric for which data is retrieved.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: The tags for the metric, as a comma-separated list of colon-separated key value pairs.

parameters.name: aggregator
parameters.description: The aggregator to use when collecting data.

parameters.name: period
parameters.description: The period to use for aggregation, as a number of minutes.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Minimum date/time for the data to retrieve.

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: Maximum date/time for the data to retrieve.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of data points to retrieve.

operations.description: Create a new alert for the given organization.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The organization name.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: A description for the alert. Should be descriptive of metric(s) and threshold(s) involved.

parameters.name: enabled
parameters.description: The state for the alert. A disabled alert is not checked.

parameters.name: period
parameters.description: How often should the condition be checked.

parameters.name: condition
parameters.description: The condition to be verified. See documentation for acceptable formats.

parameters.name: handbook_url
parameters.description: The URL of the alert handbook.

parameters.name: routing
parameters.description: Information for routing the alert to the appropriate notification service.
